item.title: By: Suresh Rathord

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
It's recommended to namespace it to your app:
We use rt.app.events as a global event handler. Everything under rt.app is an instance variable of some sort so it falls right inline with the structure of our application.
Other than that as long as you keep global events properly named you should avoid any confusion as to what they do.
item.content:encoded:
It’s recommended to namespace it to your app:

We use rt.app.events as a global event handler. Everything under rt.app is an instance variable of some sort so it falls right inline with the structure of our application.

Other than that as long as you keep global events properly named you should avoid any confusion as to what they do.

item.title: By: Suresh Rathord
item.dc:creator: Suresh Rathord
item.description:
Hi,
I have a question a very basic one though and please correct me if I am wrong. Isn't vent object a global object ? And isn't having global variables considered wrong ?
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

I have a question a very basic one though and please correct me if I am wrong. Isn’t vent object a global object ? And isn’t having global variables considered wrong ?

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description: not as a global variable. this is sample code just to show how to define it. you should attach it to a namespace object for your app, or some other object that represents your app and is available to use from your other objects (a module, for example).
item.content:encoded: not as a global variable. this is sample code just to show how to define it. you should attach it to a namespace object for your app, or some other object that represents your app and is available to use from your other objects (a module, for example).

item.title: By: The Random Guy again
item.dc:creator: The Random Guy again
item.description: Hi I have made a backbone.js simple app using asp.net mvc 4 webapi, but i am not sure if i have done it the right way,can you look at my code and suggest me the better approach than I have followed in it.I can give you the source code of it,let me know if you are willing :)
item.content:encoded: Hi I have made a backbone.js simple app using asp.net mvc 4 webapi, but i am not sure if i have done it the right way,can you look at my code and suggest me the better approach than I have followed in it.I can give you the source code of it,let me know if you are willing :)
